speaker: John
content: You know what I don't get?

speaker: Gabrielle
content: Well, he promised to give me everything I've ever wanted.

speaker: Gabrielle
content: Turns out I wanted all the wrong things.
mark: Turns out 结果是，原来是这样

speaker: John
content: Well, then, why are we here? Why are we doing this?

speaker: Gabrielle
content: Because I don't wanna wake up one morning with a sudden urge to blow my brains out.
mark: one morning 某一天早晨；有一天早上
urge 强烈的欲望，冲动；推动力；敦促，催促，力劝
blow my brains out 打爆我的头

speaker: John
content: Hey, can I have a drag?
mark: have a drag 比较口语化的短语，抽一口（烟）
drag v. 拖，拽；生拉硬拽，强迫；费劲地移动；拖沓；用鼠标拖动

speaker: Gabrielle
content: Absolutely not. You are much too young to smoke.
mark: Absolutely not 绝对不；当然不；绝不
